name: Papaya-Habanero Hot Sauce
description: Delivering on the required fruit and heat incredibly well, this hot sauce goes deeper with a slew of other fresh flavors and earthy spices to add great complexity.
recipeIngredient: 1 Caribbean red papaya, peeled, seeded, and roughly diced
1 habanero pepper, stemmed and seeded (add 1 additional habanero for an extra spicy sauce)
1/4 cup fresh juice, from 3 to 4 limes
1 teaspoon freshly minced garlic (about 1 medium clove)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Place papaya, habanero(s), shallots, vinegar, lime juice, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, allspice, cloves, cinnamon, and nutmeg in jar of a blender. Puree until smooth.

Transfer mixture to a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Let cool to room temperature, then transfer to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to a week.
